questions.text: Who was the explorer who looked for the Fountain of Youth and ended up by exploring the Florida and Puerto Rico areas?
questions.explanation:
Ponce De Leon.

	I've heard it said that there are some natural lithium springs ...

questions.text: Mel Fisher made history when he found the sunken Spanish galleon, Atocha. When did it sink?
questions.explanation:
Early 17th century.

	It took a long time - but he found it.

questions.text: The Mary Celeste was found drifting at sea - completely abandoned. No one has ever been able to explain what happened to the crew. Where was the ship found?
questions.explanation:
Atlantic Ocean.

	The Azores Islands - west of Portugal. Why would they abandon ship?

questions.text: The legend of the Holy Grail is found in many stories, often involving King Arthur and his knights. Who is usually identified as the 'pure' hero?
questions.explanation:
Galahad.

	But, what is the holy grail? There are several theories.

questions.text: The mystery of the 'Lost Colony' of Roanoke Island has never been solved. Where was the only clue to the disappearance of the settlers found?
options: In the diary of Virginia Dare
questions.explanation:
Carved in a tree.

	The word 'Croatoan' was carved in a tree.

questions.text: Which one of these abductees was found shortly after the crime was committed?
questions.explanation:
Lindbergh Baby.

	No one knows where Crater is - or why he disappeared. Amelia's disappearance has spawned many theories. Hoffa's whereabouts were the subject of speculation for a long time. The Lindbergh baby, however, was found - buried in a shallow grave.

questions.text: The 'Lost Dutchman Mine' is an enduring legend. Where is it supposedly located?
questions.explanation:
Arizona.

	Old Jacob Waltz in the mid 19th century. Gold!

questions.text: Humphrey Gilbert, Henry Hudson, James Cook and Francis Drake all looked for this at one time or another.
questions.explanation:
Northwest Passage.

	They didn't find it.

questions.text: One of Edgar Cayce's predictions concerned this mystery.
questions.explanation:
Atlantis.

	Cayce said that part of Atlantis would re-surface or be re-discovered during the second part of the 20th century. In fact, a curious and apparently man-made 'road' was discovered submerged in the Bimini area at approximtely the time that was predicted by Cayce.

questions.text: There are many mysterious creatures that have been said to exist: Abominable Snowman, Loch Ness Monster, Bigfoot, Sasquatch. What is true of all of them?
options: Stories of these creatures have been prevalent for a long time
There is photographic evidence, but it is not indisputable or conclusive
The creatures may be 'links' to species that have become extinct
questions.explanation:
All of these.

	If they can find a coelecanth off the coast of Africa in the mid 20th century ...
